history.possible_exposure_para: It is possible you were in contact with or close to someone who tested positive for COVID-19
history.what_does_this_mean_para:
Based on your GPS history, it is possible that you may have been in contact with or close to somebody who was diagnosed with COVID-19. This does not mean you are infected but that you might be.

For further information on what you should do you can refer to the Mayo Clinic’s website.
history.what_if_no_symptoms: What if I’m not showing symptoms?
history.what_if_no_symptoms_para:
If you have no symptoms but still would like to be tested you can go to your nearest testing site.

Individuals who don't exhibit symptoms can sometimes still carry the infection and infect others. Being careful about social distancing and coming in contact with large groups or at risk individuals (the elderly, those with significant other medical issues) is important to manage both your risk and the risk to others.

label.authorities_desc: Choose trusted healthcare authorities in your area to obtain exposure data. Either select a name from the global registry, or enter the web address provided by an authority which has implemented Safe Paths.
label.authorities_removal_alert_desc: Are you sure you want to remove this authority data source?
label.choose_provider_subtitle: To be informed of exposures you will need to subscribe to a health authority.
label.commitment_para: Safe Paths securely records and checks your interaction with people using your location. Your data will NEVER leave your phone without your consent.
label.event_history_subtitle: Understand your personal exposure based on information shared by health authorities.
label.export_para_1: If you test positive for COVID-19, please do your part by sharing your location history with local authorities.
label.export_para_2: Location is shared as a simple list of times and places, no additional information.
label.home_at_risk_subsubtext: This does not mean you are infected.
label.home_at_risk_subtext: Based on your GPS history, it is possible you were in contact with or close to someone diagnosed with COVID-19.
label.home_no_contact_subtext: Based on available data you haven’t been near anyone reported positive for COVID-19.
label.home_setting_off_subtext: We can’t tell if you’re at risk unless you enable location history in the settings screen.
label.home_unknown_subtext: We can’t tell if you’re at risk unless you enable the app to access your location.
label.import_step_1: Adding location data from Google will give you a head start on building your recent locations.
label.import_step_2: Before you can import, you must first 'Take out' your location data from Google.
label.import_step_3:
Visit Google Takeout and export your Location History using following settings: 
1. Delivery method: "Add to Drive" 
2. Frequency: "Export once" 
3. File type & size: ".zip" and "1GB" 
4. Google sends an email when the export is ready 
5. Return here to import locations. Import options: 
- Import from Google Drive 
- Download from browser, then import from local phone files. Make sure to be on WiFi network as files can be big.
label.launch_done_subheader: You’re ready to roll. Remember, you can always update your preferences later.
label.launch_location_header: To remember where you go, your phone needs to save your location.
label.launch_location_subheader: Don’t worry, information never leaves your device unless you explicitly decide to share.
label.launch_notif_header: Notifications will let you know if you cross paths with an infected person.
label.launch_notif_subheader: We won't bother you except to share updates on your potential exposure risks.
label.launch_screen1_header: The way back to normal starts here.
label.launch_screen2_header: Get notified if you cross paths with someone later diagnosed for COVID-19.
label.launch_screen3_header: If you test positive, you can choose to donate your data anonymously
label.launch_screen3_subheader: Which helps keep your entire community safe.
label.launch_screen4_header: You're in complete control. Data is only saved on your phone.
label.launch_screen4_subheader: If you test positive, you alone can choose whether to share.
label.location_disabled_message: COVID Safe Paths requires location services.
label.location_enabled_message: COVID Safe Paths is securely storing your GPS coordinates once every five minutes on this device.
label.maps_import_disclaimer: Safe Paths has no affiliation with Google and never shares your data.
label.maps_import_text: To see if you encountered someone with COVID-19 prior to downloading this app, you can import your personal location history.
label.news_subtitle: Read about the latest COVID updates from your health authority and in general.
label.push_at_risk_message: You have crossed paths with a COVID-19 patient
label.team_para: Our team is composed of a consortium of epidemiologists, engineers, data scientists, digital privacy evangelists, professors and researchers from reputable institutions, including: MIT, Harvard, The Mayo Clinic, TripleBlind, EyeNetra, Ernst & Young and Link Ventures.
label.tested_positive_subtitle: Your private data can be transferred to health authorities, backed up, or otherwise shared.
